definition: to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to enjoy/to benefit/to have the use of
surname Fu/abbr. for Fujian province 福建省[Fu2 jian4 sheng3]
vegetative existence/to consume passively without doing anything useful

sentences.english: Do not say, people enjoy a happy life, yet no effect to worry about.
sentences.chinese: 不说，人也享福，还没无效果，就烦恼了。

sentences.english: Fool never knows when they are well off.
sentences.chinese: 傻瓜永远不知道他何时会享福。

sentences.english: for without him, who can eat or find enjoyment?
sentences.chinese: 论到吃用，享福，谁能胜过我呢？

sentences.english: Even think, the good matter makes out more many, clay-cold inevitable live a good life in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 甚至认为，好事做得越多，死后必然在天堂里享福。

sentences.english: There is nothing better for a man, than that he should eat and drink, and that he should make his soul enjoy good in his labour.
sentences.chinese: 人莫强如吃喝，且在劳碌中享福。

definition: not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
glory, splendor, wealth and rank (idiom); high position and great wealth
lit. to eat delicious food and drink hard liquor (idiom)/fig. to live well
to endure/to suffer/hardships/torments/a hard time/a nuisance
lit. the divine steed Feihuang gallops (idiom)/fig. to achieve meteoric success in one's career
